channel.title: The New Yorker — Reporting
channel.description: Latest reporting from The New Yorker

item.title: Kash Patel’s Acts of Service
item.description: The F.B.I. director isn’t just enforcing the President’s agenda at the Bureau—he’s seeking retribution for its past investigations of Donald Trump.

item.title: Why the Time Has Finally Come for Geothermal Energy
item.description: It used to be that drawing heat from deep in the Earth was practical only in geyser-filled places such as Iceland. But new approaches may have us on the cusp of an energy revolution.

item.title: Stephen Fry Is Wilde at Heart
item.description: The polymathic entertainer has had a lifelong bond with the wittiest—and the most tortured—of writers. And now he’s starring in “The Importance of Being Earnest.”

item.title: Ariel Levy on Emily Hahn’s “The Big Smoke”
item.description: In 1969, the longtime foreign correspondent recalled a youthful adventure in which she moved to China, keen on becoming an opium addict.

item.title: Edwidge Danticat on Jamaica Kincaid’s “Girl”
item.description: The mother in Kincaid’s story is not only trying to tame a shrew; she is offering a template for survival.

item.title: The Airport-Lounge Wars
item.description: When you’re waiting for a flight, what’s the difference between out there and in here?

item.title: In Northern Scotland, the Neolithic Age Never Ended
item.description: Megalithic monuments in the otherworldly Orkney Islands remain a fundamental part of the landscape.

item.title: One of the Greatest Polar-Bear Hunters Confronts a Vanishing World
item.description: In the most remote settlement in Greenland, Hjelmer Hammeken’s life style has gone from something that worked for thousands of years to something that may not outlive him.

item.title: Disappeared to a Foreign Prison
item.description: The Trump Administration is deporting people to countries they have no ties to, where many are being detained indefinitely or forcibly returned to the places they fled.

item.title: Can Trump’s Peace Initiative Stop the Congo’s Thirty-Year War?
item.description: The President declared a diplomatic triumph. The view from the ground is more complex.
